description: Incremental tweak from iter_4: restore slightly higher liquidity_buffer to reduce overdraft without harming settlement. Simple urgency-first payment rule; basic start-of-day collateral posting and no intraday/end-of-day collateral changes.

on_true.description: Always release urgent or EOD-rush payments to avoid deadline/EOD risk.
Release when there is sufficient liquidity plus buffer.

on_false.description: Hold if not urgent and liquidity (with buffer) is insufficient.
For non-urgent payments, require effective_liquidity to cover amount times liquidity_buffer to limit overdrafts.

payment_tree.description: Release payments that are near deadline or during end-of-day rush, otherwise check liquidity adequacy.

bank_tree.description: No dynamic bank-level state or budget adjustments for this simple scenario.

on_true.description: Post a fraction of max collateral capacity at day start.

on_false.description: Do not adjust collateral during the day.

strategic_collateral_tree.description: Post initial collateral only at tick 0, then hold collateral levels intraday.

end_of_tick_collateral_tree.description: No end-of-tick collateral rebalancing; keep levels stable to avoid churn costs.
